data.title: 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing
data.meta_description: U.S. Marine Corps Sgt. Austin Wright, left, a native of Iowa, a musician, and Staff. Sgt Erica Romeo, center, a native of Florida, a musician, both with the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) Band, speak with Mr. Brian Bielby, the former president and event coordinator of the Royal Canadian Legion Branch 275,  luncheon prior to the Fergus Scottish Festival & Highland Games in Fergus in Fergus, Ontario, Canada Aug. 8, 2024. The Fergus Scottish Festival & Highland Games is an annual three-day event celebrating local Scottish heritage through various forms of entertainment. The 2nd MAW Band will be performing during the festival to strengthen community relationships and reaffirm the history, customs, and traditions represented by the United States Marine Corps. (U.S. Marine Corps photo by Staff. Sgt. Theodore Bergan)
data.text:
The 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) Band performs at the Fergus Scottish Festival & Highland Games: Day 2

U.S. Marines with the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) Band perform at the Fergus Scottish Festival & Highland Games in Fergus, Ontario, Canada, Aug. 10, 2024. The Fergus Scottish Festival & Highland Games is an annual three-day event celebrating local Scottish heritage through various forms of entertainment. The 2nd MAW Band performed during the festival to strengthen community relationships and reaffirm the history, customs, and traditions represented by the United States Marine Corps. (U.S. Marine Corps photo by Staff Sgt. Theodore Bergan)

Taken: 08.10.2024 | Photo by Staff Sgt. Theodore Bergan

2nd Marine Aircraft Wing 83rd Birthday

On July 10, 2024, 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) celebrated its 83rd birthday. (U.S. Marine Corps video by Lance Cpl. Bryan Giraldo) (Music licensed from DeWolfe Music)

Captain Jason Kellam's three Marine Corps lives: Service as an enlisted Marine, warrant officer and limited duty officer

U.S. Marine Corps Capt. Jason Kellam serves in the 2nd Marine Aircraft Wing (MAW) as the assistant operations officer in the G-6 communications section. Throughout his twenty year career he served first as an enlisted Marine, earning the rank of staff sergeant, then commissioned into the warrant officer program, earning the rank of Chief Warrant Officer 3. He now serves as a limited duty officer (LDO) at the rank of Captain. For Kellam, leading within each rank structure came not only with different expectations, but also provided different opportunities. Kellam initially considered joining the Marine Corps during his senior year in high school. Unsure of which jobs were available, at first he decided against joining. Later, faced...

07.31.2024 | MARINE CORPS AIR STATION CHERRY POINT, NORTH CAROLINA, US | Story by Lance Cpl. Orlanys Diaz Figueroa
